info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Colleton. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - A very intense band of heavy rain has developed along and east of an area of low pressure centered between Hunting Island and Edisto Island. This band of heavy rainfall is producing hourly rainfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour across Edisto, Seabrook Island, and Kiawah Island. The band is expected to progress to the north and will impact Folly Beach, West Ashley, Downtown Charleston, and Mount Pleasant over the next 1 to 2 hours. Intense rainfall rates will cause minor flooding across this area, likely making some roadways impassable, especially in and around Downtown Charleston - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Edisto Beach, Johns Island, James Island, West Ashley, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Sullivan`s Island, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Maybank Bridge and James Island County Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
